main_definition: Completely, to the greatest extent or in every aspect.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In a state of being completely satisfied or content with something.
meanings_and_examples.example: After receiving her long-awaited promotion, she felt fully satisfied and accomplished.

meanings_and_examples.definition: With all available resources or means used to the maximum degree.
meanings_and_examples.example: The team worked fully on the project, utilizing every tool at their disposal.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In a manner that is complete and without any omission; entirely.
meanings_and_examples.example: He explained the situation fully to ensure there were no misunderstandings.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Without leaving anything out or being partial; completely unbiased.
meanings_and_examples.example: The judge delivered a full and impartial judgment without any favoritism.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To the maximum extent possible, particularly in terms of time or effort.
meanings_and_examples.example: She worked fully on her art project for three hours straight.
